Title: What is your number
Kanji: さくら：　ところで　アンナさん。　電話番号　は　何番　です　か？
アンナ：　ええと。。。　れい　はち　れい　いち　に　さん　よん。
さくら：　ありがとう。　じゃ、　今度、　電話　を　します　ね
Kana: さくら：　ところで　アンナさん。でんわ ばんごう　は　なん ばん　です　か？
アンナ：　ええと。。。れい　はち　れい　いち　に　さん　よん。
さくら：　ありがとう。じゃ　こんど、でんわ　を　します　ね。
Romaji: Sakura: Tokorode Anna-San. Denwa bangō wa nan ban desu ka
Anna: Êto. Rei Hachi Rei - Ichi Ni San Yon...
Sakura: Arigatō. Ja, Kondo, denwa o shimasu ne.
English: Sakura: By the way Anna. What is your phone number?
Sakura: Thank you. I'll phone you next time, Ok?
Vocabulary: - ところで = By the way (ところで - Tokorode)
- 電話番号 = Telephone Number [1.電話 = Phone (でんわ - Denwa) 2.番号 = Number (ばんごう - Bangō)
- 番 =  Counter Number (ばん - Ban) = A counter is a word to count things in Japanese.
- 何番 = What number (1.なん 2.ばん - 1.Nan 2.Ban)
- じゃ = Ya, Casual way of connecting sentences
- 今度 = This time, Next time (でんわ - Kondo)
- ね = Ok? Particle to reafirm something you are saying.
Description: - します (Shimasu) = It's a verb which means to do something.
- The particle を can be written in rōmaji as O or Wo. It is pronounced more like O.
- を marks the direct object in a sentence. The direct object is the noun which receives the action of the verb.
- In Japanese, を always comes right after the direct object in a sentence, followed by a verb at the end.
- Structure  SOMETHING + を(wo) + します(Shimasu) = Talk about actions. Examples:
- べんきおう Study => べんきおう を します (Benkiō o shimasu) => I study
- りようり Study => りようり を します (Ryōri o shimasu) => I cook
- でんわ Phone, Call => でんわ　を　します (Denwa o shimasu) => I will call, I will phone
